JENNY DEATH WHEN

Em minha opinião, esse jogo é o melhor de toda franquia Half-Life. Pois Half-Life 2: Episode Two, mistura tudo o que há de melhor nos jogos anteriores, em adição á revelações surpreendentes no enredo e plot twists memoráveis. Além de conter gráficos satisfatórios até para a geração atual, incluiu novas mecânicas e adicionou uma atmosfera misteriosa porém imersiva, na qual a história envolvendo o quase fim da humanidade, um pé de cabra, um cientista numa roupa laranja mutcho loca e uma garota que nasceu com o sangue rebelde correm contra o tempo para aproveitar a única chance em anos de resistência de acabar com seus opressores que tomaram a terra e escravizaram a humanidade. Além de resolver conflitos internos que perseguem Gordon Freeman aonde ele for. Aonde ele estiver. Digo que este jogo é o melhor de todos pois, além de tudo, você irá se emocionar a cada momento novo, cada descoberta do passado nova. Você irá se emocionar com a única chance da Terra contra-atacar. Você irá se agarrar nessa oportunidade de revanche tanto quanto os personagens. Você vai sorrir, chorar, e sentir orgulho de um jogo que, mesmo se passando em uma época distópica, não está fora de contexto da nossa atual realidade social.
Você, meu caro, vai viver esse jogo, e cada momento dele, cada momento de Gordon Freeman, como se fosse seu.
GAME THAT DESERVES A SEQUEL 2016
GAME THAT DESERVES A SEQUEL 2017

I first played half-life 2 when I was a wee lad at the tender age of 14 years old. Since that time I have loved and lost, gone through many coming of man rituals and have experienced many triumphs and failures. Since that time, I have lost a grandfather, an uncle, even my mother past this year. It is often said people are gone but not lost and I do believe they watch me from above. They never had the chance to rejoice at my final victory against the Combine but I know they would enjoy watching it from the crescent of Jesus's embrace. Gabe I implore you, this game deserves a sequel. I mean if you ever go back and do like a super classic kind of product.
They should really make more of these games.
Still one of the best paced and must fun games to play. In desperate need of resolution.

Recomendo esse jogo com certeza.

Во время выхода The Orange Box, я обратил внимание на эту серию.
Сперва я не понимал хайпа вокруг этой игры. Но когда сыграл - понял насколько она крута, а сейчас, запуская заново, осознаешь, что в свое время 2 часть была невероятна. Ни один боевик не давал тех возможностей что были в этой игре.Episode Two это продолжение любимой многими игры.
Все хотят продолжения, не только ради  того чтобы узнать что же дальше, а для того чтобы лицезреть революцию в жанре.

This is, in my opinion, the pinnacle of Valve's creation. They will never again be on the same height as they were after releasing The Orange Box. Today their game development capabilities are a joke. I will try to describe, with my little composition skills, how much this masterpiece of the art of computer games making means to me and probably most other people that played it.

First of all, I think any words are quite pointless here because simply having this legendary ending to the legendary game series must satisfy you enough by itself. Just imagine the eons the future generations will have to endure while waiting for another entry in the series. After Epistle 3 by Marc Laidlaw, we finally have some compensation for the years of lack of communication by Valve. Thanks to that short summarization of the purported Episode Three plot, the series is that much more precious knowing that this is all we are going to get in the centuries to come.

And there is much to be happy about. This Episode is the result of many years of perfecting the craft of game making. Owing to that process, the game is packed with content, action, detail, story, and emotion. With flawless technical execution, the Source Engine flourishes like never before, and everything is clean and sharp. The newly added cinematic physics used during the destruction of buildings or parts of architecture never ceases to amaze. Vortigaunts were revamped completely, looking pretty sleek, being voiced by a different voice actor and their combat prowess was improved including incredible new vortal lightning effects which make the defense against the hordes of Antlions one of the heights of the series. Let's not forget about Hunters, which are a new type of synth enemy that will hound you throughout the game. The sounds they make are as amazing as those of Striders and Gunships.

The story is packed with intensity, there is a new brilliantly voiced, and written character, Dr. Magnusson, and many new cards are laid on the table, including the interconnectedness with Portal. G-Man has a wonderful heart-to-heart scene, where he states his intentions on how the plot may unravel. Again, the mimics of the expressions of the main cast is just awe-inspiring, and every dialogue is a joy to behold.

I don't dare to think how great Episode Three or Half-Life 3 could have been if Valve made it in their prime. But the quality and the legacy they left us with are extremely satisfying.

"No...don't leave me."

10/10

+ the pinnacle of the Half-Life experience, excellent storytelling with heavy emotions, flawless technical execution, countless memorable moments
- cliff-hanger ending
Will they ever release Half-Life 3?
